subSections.title: Readings
Compounds
Etymology 1
subSections.text:
{{elements|Fe|{{ja-r|マンガン}}|Mn|{{ja-r|コバルト}}|Co|lang=ja|sort=てつ}} {{wikipedia|lang=ja}} {{wikipedia|Iron}}
{{ja-kanjitab|てつ|yomi=o}} Borrowed from {{bor|ja|ltc|-|sort=てつ}} {{ltc-l|鐵|gloss=iron}}. Compare modern {{etyl|cmn|-}} reading ''tiě'', {{etyl|hak|-}} ''thiet''.

subSections.title: Noun
Idioms
subSections.text: * {{ja-r|鉄は熱いうちに打て|てつ は あつい うち に うて}}: “[[strike while the iron is hot]]”

subSections.title: Etymology 2
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|くろがね|r=y}}

Compound of {{compound|ja|sort=くろがね|黒|tr1=kuro|t1=black|金|tr2=kane|t2=metal}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref> {{rendaku2|kane|gane|sort=くろがね}} Compare the ''black'' in {{cog|en|blacksmith}}.

subSections.title: Noun
Etymology 3
Usage notes
subSections.text: The {{l|ja|金}} spelling is the most common for this term.
